name: Divine Weapon Master (WM and CoT hybrid build with FIG as starting class) with lvl 40 max
author: NobleSky

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content: I am thinking about a build using a WM and CoT hybrid, inspired by 'Kukri Master' made by HipMaestro, but instead of going dual kukri, I want to build a sword (katana or bastard sword) and shield toon with dev crit, EWS, and divine wrath buff. The problem is divine wrath which duration is dependent on the character's CHA modification. I have a character in mind with the starting stats of STR 15, DEX 14, CON 12, WIS 8, INT 14, and CHA 14. STR will be the primary stats until 26 and then I will pump the rest to CHA so the final stats will be STR 26 and CHA 20 (+5 CHA). I am not sure if 5 rounds of divine wrath is considered "worth it" so should I drop the divine wrath idea and go with heavy WM level at F 6/ WM 24/ CoT 10? Sure, I can equip CHA equipment of greater mask persuasion (+2 CHA), Nymph cloak +7 (+7 CHA), Belt of the Performer +5 (+5 CHA) , and Prophyro's Ring +4 (+4 CHA) which totaled to +18 CHA but that would limit the choice of equipment for my character. Is the bonus CHA counted to divine wrath duration? If it is, then I would go for level spread of F 6/ WM 19/ CoT 15 for a more "balanced" approach, or is it better if I go with heavy CoT level at F 6/ WM 14/ CoT 20?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I like how you seek to explore a lot of new and different possibilities NobleSky, this reminds me a lot of my own interests.
Its an interesting idea to try to make a build around Divine Wrath.
I like how you combine a high AB class such as weapon master, to allow extra investment in charisma so the AB doesn't suffer.
I have been reluctant to pursue a Divine Wrath focused build because of the single use / day and CHA modifier duration
However in a non-rest restricted environment maybe it could do very well.

Bard RDD CoT seems like a good way to combine Dev crit and a decent Divine Wrath, but you would have to drop WM. 
Stag's Firewing of Corellion might give you some ideas, that is a very powerful build, an elf as well. 
Valerfor's Holy Smiting Dragon as well, that looks like a very relevant read as well. 
This is the stats from Valerfor's build: Divine Wrath: +9 Attack Bonus/ +9 Divine Dmg/ +9 to all Saves/ Dmg Reduction (15/ +3)

RE the +18 CHA you write about, the ability cap is +12, the settings might need to be changed to get to +18, I think CTRL-SHIFT-F12 on the EE version may allow for the ability cap to be adjusted. A humble potion of Eagle Splendor also can help add to CHA as well.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
Thank you very much for the assist and advice, Orion. I haven't thought about using RDD 10 to improve the STR for dev crit requirement. Bard is also another CHA oriented class which has synergy to high CHA build, though bard is only a drop-in class for the RDD requirement.  Valerfor's version seems to be the closest to the kind of build that I have in mind. From what I gathered, the final CHA of my build is 20 + 12 = 32 (11 rounds if the CHA bonus modification is counted to divine wrath). I will keep this information for future builds.

If I go WM heavy (F 6/ WM 24/ CoT 10), I have more feats investment, WM AB bonus +5, divine wrath buff : attack/damage/save bonus +5 and damage reduction 5/ +1.
If I go CoT heavy (F 6/ WM 14/ CoT 20), I have less feats investment, WM AB bonus +2, divine wrath buff : attack/damage/save bonus +9 and damage reduction 15 /+3.
For "balanced" (F 6 / WM 19/ CoT 15), I got some feats investment, WM AB bonus +4, divine wrath buff : attack/damage/save bonus +7 and damage reduction 10 /+2.

I guess I am gonna roll with "balanced" so that I am not overly reliant to divine wrath due to 1 usage per day. Onward to the build then.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
How about choosing a martial weapon instead of an exotic one and replace "weapon pro: exotic" with "divine might"?
Divine damage is almost always useful.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
My concern here is about Dev Crit. Of course it always sounds nice having the chance for a one-hit kill, but you have to take the DC into account, otherwise it's just useful for trash-mobs, which you should be able to deal with anyway. I try not to include Dev Crit unless its natural (unbuffed) DC is over 40, and here it's 38. I'm just thinking about the feat investment involved.

It might just be me, though.

Cheers

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Dev Crit is, as always, environment dependent.

Where I play, you are basically fishing for 1s - or fighting trash m0bs.

Most End Bosses are immune to Crits, or have saves that make your Dev Crit chance laughable (fishing for a 1).  This from a Str 50 Devver.

So under such circumstances, other options are very valid.

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
@ Aquarius 233: The reason I chose exotic weapon is because the build I am inspired from uses exotic weapon ("kukri master") so I kept the exotic weapon but repurposed it to sword and shield combat style. If you prefer to have martial weapon (like scimitar or longsword), you can replace the "exotic weapon pro" with lvl 1 feat (like luck of heroes), great fortitude to better your fortitude save, or toughness for more HP. Exotic weapon usually has slightly higher base damage and similar critical threat range with martial weapons. Sadly, "divine might" or "divine shield" feat is only available to cleric, paladin, or blackguard class so the only buff I can lean on comes from divine wrath/potions/equipment.

@ Stagmeister and webshaman1 : Dev crit is taken because the remaining options are not too thrilling, the only "Great (stats)" improvement from bonus feat is Great Wisdom from CoT bonus feat and this build has little/nothing to do with WIS stat. Epic toughness is other alternative (if only toughness is available as bonus feat). Other more useful feats need higher DEX or CON investment, which leaves the bonus feats limited unless you plan to postpone some feats (like Great Cleave or Knockdown) into epic levels and take more investment in pre-epic levels (should you go without Dev Crit feat btw).

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
I realized that my comment was not complete: just want to add that I would prefer an ability like "divine might" with multiple uses per day together with a once-per-day ability. Practically, dev crit DC is lower because of the CHA increase used for "Divine might".

I understand that this would be another build (I think of Valerfor's Harvester of Souls).

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
@ Aquarius 233: Divine Might used up your Turn Undead attempt and increase your damage bonus according to your CHA modification compared to divine wrath that increases your attack/damage/save bonus and damage reduction with CHA modification as the duration but can only be used 1x per day. I agree that the divine wrath saw more limited use compared to divine might. I will post a second build with "Divine Weapon Master" theme but by going WM heavy for those who aren't going to use divine wrath, so all of those CHA points can be pumped to STR. I added Iron Will (replaced with IKD as Stagmeister's suggestion), Great Fortitude, Epic Will, and Epic Fortitude to increase the fortitude and will saving throw. Great Cleave and EWS are only available as CoT bonus feat which is the reason they are taken before O Crit and Dev Crit. WM 22 has the same AB bonus as WM24 so I can take 2 fighter levels for more feat slot.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've a couple of minor suggestions as tweaks if you don't mind, NobleSky.

First, take WS at Fighter 4, and Spring Attack and Whirlwind Attack together at Fighter 6.

Likewise, take EWS at CoT 8 (L27), and Great Cleave at CoT 10 (L29), assuming it's really only being taken for access to Dev Crit.

Finally, and this is more about personal preference, I'd be tempted to lose Iron Will, taking both KD and Blind Fight at CoT 4 (L15), then taking IKD at CoT 6 (L19).

Just my tuppence-worth.

Cheers

posts.author: NobleSky
posts.content:
Let's try to do some math calculations (please correct me if I make the wrong formula). I double checked at nwnwiki and the bonus from divine wrath is actually attack roll (not attack bonus), damage bonus, and saving throws.

"Balanced" with divine wrath buff: max AB at 46 (with +7 attack roll and damage bonus/divine damage) vs
Non-buffed WM Heavy : max AB at 49 (no bonus)

"Balanced" with divine wrath buff: saving throw 30/24/31 (with +7 bonus) vs
Non-buffed WM Heavy : saving throw 35/26/29 (no bonus)

Conclusion: Buffed-up "Balanced" build will have better attack and saving throw compared to non-buffed WM heavy but as long as divine wrath activates.

posts.content: Changing to  Fighter 8 / WM 22 / CoT 10 would trade -2 on saves for one more feat and +1 AB.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Nice slugger build, Stag.
I just sit here and wonder why you take intelligence 14?
You get 10 skill points and a +1 to int based skills. Do I miss out on something here?
If you change the level split to CoT 12/ WM 22, you increase AB to 51 and keep 12 CoT levels for the saves bonus.
You can still take EWS on an epic CoT level.
You lose the great intelligence and gain a near useless WM bonus feat. Saves bonus is also ÷1. But AB is AB and that was some of the point with this build, right?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, that's true. I confess, I was a bit annoyed by having, effectively, one loose class at level 40 - it could reasonably have been any one of them.

So, in epic levels, use the F8 bonus feat for EWS, the 2 CoT ones for OwCrit and DevCrit (or some amalgam of the 3), and the 4 WM ones for ASkin, EProw, EWF, and probably Epic Toughness, which is a bit meh, but does take the hps to a nice 500. The Will save starts to tremble a bit (20), but should suffice. The AC remains shonky, but there's little that can be done about that.

I'll see what I can do...

Thanks!

EDIT:  Ninja'd by Mick! The above was a reply to Empyre's post. Now I have the views of the Kukri Grandmaster to take into account as well. Just as a btw, I'd assumed the INT increase would be backdated - much as Toughness is for hps - but if not, my skills schedule is well out of whack. Need to think...
